exampleModule¶

This is the example file for f2org. The f2org is used to extract the comments from the code to emacs-org mode.

Some notes:

  • Only work for module file

  • Some code should be written in a specific way, such as the intent in and intent out.

  • pandoc can be used to convert .org to .md or rst.

  • Use of modules:

Use mod_1
Use mod_2

  • list of variables:

Integer :: foo1
Real(4) :: foo2

example_subroutine_1¶

  • Use of modules:

use mod_3

input variables

None

output variables

None

  • list of local variables:

this line will

continue but not this line

example_subroutine_2¶

Some scripts for example_subroutine_2

  • Use of modules:

use mod_3

input variables

Integer, Intent(In) :: foo4
Real(4), Dimension(2,2), Intent(In) :: foo5

output variables

Real(4), Intent(Out) :: foo6

  • list of local variables:

Integer :: foo7
Integer :: foo8

Print('some_scripts1') !->>
Print('some_scripts2')
Print('some_scripts3') !-<<

example_function¶

  • Use of modules:

None

input variables

Integer, Intent(In) :: foo_1
Real(4), Dimension(2,2) :: foo_2

output variables

Real(4), Intent(Out) :: foo_3

  • list of local variables:

None

Print('some_scripts1') !-><
